title: User can export the MN League Roster widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on the MN League Roster widget
AND Under the download icon, there is an option to export to excel and an option to export to pd
custom_steps: WHEN Choosing export to excel
custom_expected: THEN it will generate an excel document with the currently selected MN Roster, including all of the visible columns

title: User can export the MJ League Roster widget
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is under the download icon on the MJ League Roster widget
AND there is an option to export to excel and an option to export to pdf
custom_steps: WHEN Choosing export to excel
custom_expected: THEN it will generate an excel document with the currently selected MJ Roster, including all of the visible columns.

title: User can see employees at the bottom of the MJ Roster widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the MJ Roster Widget
custom_steps: WHEN at the bottom of the Roster widget
custom_expected:
THEN any employees listed will display AFTER all of the players (still sorted by Last, First). 
AND Rows that contain employees should only display the employee's Name and Roster Status - all other columns should be blank.

title: BOC user can see the Roster Counts widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN BOC user is on HOME page
custom_steps: WHEN clicking Roster Widget
custom_expected:
THEN The widget header will have a filter to choose which of the 30 Clubs rosters to display - defaulted for the BOC to the first alphabetically. 
AND The widget will match the provided wireframe, and will have enough blocks/rows to provide the current active and under control limits for each of the active MJ and MN affiliates for each Org. 
AND The Affiliates will be ordered in descending order based on level of play (MJ, then AAA, etc.) 
AND Each Affiliate block will contain the affiliate's current logo, the number of currently open action items the team has for stats violations, the number of preliminary transactions impacting the Affiliate, and the number of pending transactions for the Affiliate (Submitted to Club or BOC). 
AND Mousing over the Active or Under Control number for each club will display the text "Active Limit: 25" and "Under Control Limit: 40".  This should be implemented the same way it was for the Major and Minor League Roster widgets.

title: User can view each player's years of minor league service on the minor league roster widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the minor league roster widget
custom_steps: when on the Minor League Roster widget
custom_expected: THEN Mn Lg Service Yrs will be a visible column

title: User can see a player's Rule 5 information in the MJ Roster widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the MJ Roster widget
custom_steps: WHEN on the Major League Roster widget
custom_expected:
THEN "DE/SEL" is a visible column
AND If player is currently DE or SEL then it appears in the column. 
BUT If player does not have a Rule 5 Status of DE or SEL for the current year then the column is blank.

title: As a user I want to save a Post Season roster in the Roster Management utility
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Post Season roster is loaded in the roster management utility there is a Save button present for both BOC and Club users.
* Clicking "Save" will Save the roster as it is currently displayed in the utility. 
* A blue successful save notification should display.

title: As a Club user I want to Submit a Post Season roster
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Post Season roster is loaded in the roster management utility there is a Submit button present for Club users.
* Clicking "Submit" will Save the roster as it is currently displayed in the utility. 
* A blue successful submit notification should display. 
* An approvals item is generated for the BOC. The From Org should be the submitting Org. The description should read "Major League special roster (DS) has been submitted.â€￾ with the portion in parenthesis being replaced with the abbreivation of the corresponding special roster. 
  - Division Series - DS
  - World Series - WS 
  - Wild Card - WC
  - League Championship Series - LCS

title: As a user I want to see a warning if I attempt to Save a Post Season roster that has already been saved
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Roster+Management+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria: 
* Clicking "Submit" or "Save" as a Club user, or "Approve" or "Save" as a BOC user will check to see if the roster currently displayed has already been saved.
* If yes, then an error is displayed. See Messages #2.

title: As a Club user I want to see the Roster Management utility
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The Roster Management utility is currently a BOC only utility and is controlled by the ebis-roster-management-editors LDAP. We need to adjust this so that we can display this for the BOC as well as Clubs (can create a new LDAP or just use Org to control it). 
* Club users with this permission should see the utility as an option under "Rosters" dashboard as "Special Rosters", but they should only be able to see the following Roster Types:
 - Division Series  
 - Wild Card  
 - League Championship Series  
 - World Series 
* They should not be allowed to change the Org - it should be defaulted to their own Org.

title: As a BOC user I want to Approve a Post Season roster
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=roster_management

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Post Season roster is loaded in the roster management utility there is an Approve button present for BOC users.
* Clicking "Approve" will Save the roster as it is currently displayed in the utility, and flag the current year's special roster as approved.
* If an approvals item exists for this roster, it is dismissed. 
* A blue successful approve notification should display. 
* A notification is generated for all Orgs. The From Org should be the Org. The description should read "Major League special roster (DS) has been approved.â€￾ with the portion in parenthesis being replaced with the abbreivation of the corresponding special roster. 
  - Division Series - DS
  - World Series - WS 
  - Wild Card - WC
  - League Championship Series - LCS

Report Layout: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Post+Season+Eligibility+Roster+Report+Layout

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Post Season Eligibility Roster" is a report in the Report listing widget. Selecting this report from the widget will launch the prompts according to the requirements. 
* The category of this report should be "Rosters". 
* Entering the desired prompts and running the report will work and match the requirements.

title: A User can View Reports and Associated Information in the Reports Widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a User is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN on the Reports Widget
custom_expected: THEN the user can view Reports and Associated information

title: BOC Approver can approve transactions from the clipboard
custom_preconds:
GIVEN The following transactions should be able to be approved from the clipboard with the Approve button:
     - Report Date
     - Return of 26th Man
     - Sign Free Agent - BOC only tx
     - Loan
     - Return
     - Release
     - Transfer
custom_steps:
WHEN selecting a tx on the approvals widget should enable the "Approve" button
AND clicking approve button
custom_expected:
THEN the system will update all of the selected txs to have a status of "Approved"
AND make all "On Approved" updates for all of the selected txs

title: A user can save an advanced search
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is on an advanced search
AND "Save Search" appears and is enabled as soon as the first filter's criteria is added.
BUT "Save Search" is disabled if no criteria is entered.
custom_steps: WHEN clicking "Save Search"
custom_expected:
THEN it triggers a pop-up that allows the user to enter in the title of their search. 
AND no check is made to ensure that the title isn't already in use. 
AND clicking "Save" will store the search criteria under the entered title. 
AND a blue notification will appear to indicate that the search was saved. 
AND the saved searches dropdown is now populated with the option and the option is active.

title: A user can run a saved search
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has one or more searches saved
AND a dropdown with the placeholder text "Saved searches" appears to the right of the search for dropdown on the advanced search screen
custom_steps: WHEN selecting a saved search from the dropdown
custom_expected:
THEN it will set the "Search For" dropdown to the type associated with the saved search
AND populate the filters section with the saved filter criteria. 
AND The loaded filters will be editable. 
AND The search will not initiate until the user clicks "Search"
BUT If the user has no saved searches this dropdown is not visible.

title: User can view the Taxi Squad widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is a BOC or Club user
custom_steps:
WHEN on the Transactions Dashboard
AND Taxi Squad is available
custom_expected:
THEN BOC user can see an Org column
AND Club users can NOT see an Org column
AND all of the entries should be filtered to only display their own Orgs entries
AND column header should contain a date range filter
AND date range should default to the last 30 days

title: User can edit a row in the Taxi Squad widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user is on the taxi squad widget
custom_steps: WHEN clicking the pencil icon that is displayed on each row
custom_expected:
THEN the row will be placed into edit mode
AND pencil icon becomes an X
AND User can place more than one row into edit mode at a time

title: BOC user can edit an existing manually added entry in a player's player history
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has a new manual entry that has been saved to the player history
AND a pencil icon appears in view mode for ONLY the rows that have been manually added
custom_steps: WHEN Clicking on the pencil icon places the entire row in edit mode, and enables a save button.
custom_expected:
THEN user has the ability to edit all values of the manual entry
AND Save must be clicked to maintain any changes to the row

title: Club can edit their pro player's profiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is logged in as Club
custom_steps:
WHEN the user edits a pro player profile that belongs to Club
AND Saves
custom_expected:
ThEN the changes are successfully saved
AND a blue notification appears

title: BOC user can edit Int'l Amateur player profiles
custom_preconds: GIVEN a BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN BOC user views an International Amateur Profile
custom_expected:
THEN International Amateur Profile should have an Edit button in View mode
AND BOC users should be able to edit all sections of the profile
AND clicking edit should reload the profile in edit mode
AND Contact Information section should be displayed as separate sections for Phone Numbers, Emails, and Addresses
AND By default, at least one address fieldset, one phone number fieldset, and one email fieldset should display
AND users should be able to add additional address, phone, and email fieldsets by clicking the Add button found in each section
AND Users should be able to remove additional fieldsets by clicking on the trashcan icon
AND trashcan icon should only display in edit mode
AND if only one fieldset in a section displays, then the trashcan icon should NOT display
AND users should have the ability to select the country associated with the address
AND country selected should drive what additional fields display, and whether they are Select2 or Text inputs
AND while in edit mode, a Save button should be available

title: View an Int'l Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
custom_steps:
WHEN user navigates to an International Grandfathered Profile 

ex:  Eriel Sanchez - https://ebisbf.mlb.com/ebisui/#/intl-amateur/info?playerId=399974
custom_expected:
THEN profile should match the layout of the wireframe and data discovery
AND only BOC users should see the Attached Files and Comments sections
AND contact information that was entered on a grandfathered profile in ebis 2 should appear on the grandfathered profile in ebis 2.5
AND layout of the contact information should match the wireframe
(Note that some fields that display on International Amateur profile do NOT display on International Grandfathered profile)

title: Save an Int'l Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to an International Grandfathered Profile
custom_expected:
THEN Edit button should be present on International Grandfathered profile
AND BOC users should be able to edit all sections of the profile
AND club users should be able to edit the Contact Information and Scouting Info Sections ONLY
AND edit functionality should be the same as: https://www.pivotaltracker.com/story/show/128354701
AND clicking Save should run a required fields rules check
AND once required fields check has passed, changes should be committed and profile should load in view mode
BUT clicking Cancel should ask the user if they are sure they wish to cancel
AND if user confirms the cancellation no changes should be committed and profile should load in view mode
BUT  if user does not confirm the cancellation the user should be returned to the profile in edit mode

title: As a user I want to be able to print the Service tab of a professional player profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=printing

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a user has permission to see a player profile, then they see a Print button on the profile.
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the player's Service tab. 
* The pdf will ONLY display what the logged in user has permission to see on the Service tab within the app. 
* The width of the info should be limited to one page, with text wrapping as necessary. 
* The top of the pdf should contain the Player's Roster Name, Middle Initial, Last Name, baseball position, Club/Org, MLS, MJ and MN roster status and Player ID.

title: As a user I want to be able to print the CSP tab of a professional player profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=printing

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a user has permission to see a player profile, then they see a Print button on the profile.
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the player's CSP tab. 
* The pdf will ONLY display what the logged in user has permission to see on the CSP tab within the app.
* If the user doesn't have CSP/CEP permissions, they will not see the option in the print modal.
* If the player doesn't have a CSP/CEP, the option will not appear in the print modal.
* The width of the info should be limited to one page, with text wrapping as necessary. 
* The top of the pdf should contain the Player's Roster Name, Middle Initial, Last Name, baseball position, Club/Org, MLS, MJ and MN roster status and Player ID.

title: As a user I want to be able to print the Draft & Scouting tab of a professional player profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe: 
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=printing

Acceptance Criteria: 
* If a user has permission to see a player profile, then they see a Print button on the profile.
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the player's Draft & Scouting tab. 
* The pdf will ONLY display what the logged in user has permission to see on the Draft & Scouting tab within the app. 
* The width of the info should be limited to one page, with text wrapping as necessary. 
* The top of the pdf should contain the Player's Roster Name, Middle Initial, Last Name, baseball position, Club/Org, MLS, MJ and MN roster status and Player ID.

title: As a club user I don't want to be able to open another Club's credit
custom_steps: Acceptance Criteria: * When viewing a player's CSP or CEP Summary tab, the Credits are not hyperlinks if the viewing user's Org is not BOC or the Responsible Org. * This applies to both CSP and CEP credits.

title: As a Club user I want to see the CSP Players widget
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_players_and_questionnaire

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=94669235

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When a Club user lands on the CSP/CEP dashboard, the "Current CSP/CEP" widget displays. 
* There is no "Org" filter in the header. The widget should only be populated with players for whom the viewing Org is the Responsible Org and the user should not be able to view another Org's information.  
* Org column should not be available. 
* The widget should be populated with all of the players who have CSP with a status of Current, Current - Living Allowance Only or Current - Tuition Allowance Only. Completed and Lapsed players should not display. 
* The widget layout should match the provided data discovery. (aside from the exceptions noted already)
* Default sort should be on player's Last Name, secondary sort on player's First Name. 
* Player's Name should be a hyperlink to the player's profile - > CSP Tab. 
* Remaining, Used and Commitment columns will contain the relevant values from the player's CSP tabs. Players who have separate tuition and living allowances will display with "T - $0 / L -$0" per the wireframe. Players without the separation will display a single dollar amount in each column. 
* Estimated Lapsed Date logic/population will be delivered with another story. 
* 10 -Year Expiration should match that on the player's profile where applicable (not applicable to those who do not have a Living Allowance), this column should be blank for those players. 
* Questionnaire Sent column will be populated in a follow up story. 
* Default filter behavior and export should be delivered with this story.

title: As a Club user I want to be able to Print Multiple Questionnaires
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_players_and_questionnaire

Acceptance Criteria: 
* When viewing the Current CSP/CEP widget, if the user has CSP Edit permissions, they see a "Print Questionnaires" button on the widget. 
* Clicking "Print Questionnaires" will launch a popover for the user to enter a Club Contact.
* Clicking "Print" from the popover will find all of the players on the selected Org that do not yet have a date populated for "Questionnaire Sent" and generate a single pdf containing the Questionnaires for all of the players. 
* The Questionnaires printed for each player should match what would print for the player if the user selected "Print Questionnaire" from the player's profile and selected "Player" and their primary address. 

*As part of this story we need to translate the boolean from ebis1 to a date in ebis2. If the player is marked as sent in ebis1 then we should populate a date, and those not yet marked sent should remain blank*

title: As a user I want to be able to print a CEP Needs More Info letter from a player's profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=print_letter
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp

Report Layout:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Needs+More+Info+-+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Needs+More+Info+-+Report+Details

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Print Letter" is a button on the CEP tab of the Professional Player Profile. 
* Clicking "Print Letter" will launch a popover with a selection of available player letters to create. 
* "Needs More Info" will be one of the options. 
* Selecting Needs More Info will launch a pop-up where the user can enter information to be pre-populated in the form. 
* The pop-up should match the provided wireframe. 
* The Print button should be disabled until all required fields have been filled in
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the Needs More Info letter in the selected language according to the provided requirements.

title: As a user I want to be able to print a CEP Welcome Kit from a player's profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=print_letter
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp

Report Layout:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Welcome+Kit+-+Report+Layout

Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Welcome+Kit+-+Report+Details

Acceptance Criteria: 
* "Print Letter" is a button on the CEP tab of the Professional Player Profile. 
* Clicking "Print Letter" will launch a popover with a selection of available player letters to create. 
* "Welcome Kit" will be one of the options. 
* Selecting Welcome Kit will launch a pop-up where the user can enter information to be pre-populated in the form. 
* The pop-up should match the provided wireframe. 
* The Print button should be disabled until all required fields have been filled in
* Clicking "Print" will generate a pdf of the Welcome Kit in the selected language according to the provided requirements.

title: As a user I want to edit a CEP tab on a player profile for a player with CEP
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=cep

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/CEP+Summary+-+Data+Discovery

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The CEP Summary tab has an Edit button in view mode if the user has CSP edit permissions. 
* Clicking edit puts the Summary tab into edit mode, according to the Data Discovery. 
* A Save button and a cancel button are available in Edit mode.
* Clicking "Save" will conduct a required field and formatting check according to the data discovery. 
* Once the required field check has passed, the changes will be saved and a blue successful save notification will be displayed. The page will reload in View mode. 
* Any changes that were made to the Payment History are reflected in the associated Invoice.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they are sure that they wish to lose any changes. If they confirm, the form is put back in view mode and no changes are saved. If they do not confirm, the modal is closed and they are returned to the form in edit mode with their changes still present.

title: As a user I want to be able to edit the CSP Summary on a professional player profile (Post 10/3/04)
custom_preconds: Give user is on Players CSP summary profile
custom_steps: When Clicking an edit button in View mode
custom_expected:
* Special attention should be paid to the differences between the versions of CSP, such as the available CSP statuses, Date Completed field and Net Amount field. 
* A Save button and a cancel button are available in Edit mode.
* Clicking "Save" will conduct a required field and formatting check according to the data discovery. 
* Once the required field check has passed, the changes will be saved and a blue successful save notification will be displayed. The page will reload in View mode. 
* Any changes that were made to the Payment History are reflected in the associated Invoice.
* Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they are sure that they wish to lose any changes. If they confirm, the form is put back in view mode and no changes are saved. If they do not confirm, the modal is closed and they are returned to the form in edit mode with their changes still present.

title: As a user I want to be able to Save and Print from a CSP Invoice
custom_preconds:
GIVEN user is logged in as BOC/Club
AND viewing a CSP Invoice
custom_steps: WHEN clicking "Edit"
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see a "Print Letter" button with a drop down, in addition to the Save and Cancel buttons
AND clicking "Print Letter" will allow the user to select which letter they want to print. 
AND after printing clicking "Save" will save any changes the user made
AND a blue message will display "CSP Summary Saved Successfully"

title: As a user I want to be able to save a new CSP invoice (Post 10/3/2004)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that user is viewing a CSP profile
AND has entered an invoice for an academic term that already has an invoice entered into eBis 1
custom_steps: WHEN making edits and Clicking the save button
custom_expected:
THEN
* It will run a required field and formatting check according to the provided data discovery. The fields required will vary slightly depending on what "Status" is selected for the Invoice (not the CSP Status).
* CSP Status, Net Amount and Date Completed fields should be paid special attention.
* Once the required field and formatting check and any other rule checks (covered in other stories) have passed, the form is saved. 
* The Created and Created By fields are set accordingly. 
* A blue successful save notification is displayed. 
* The Invoice appears in the player's Payment History on the Summary tab. 
* Any updates made to the CSP Status, Date Lapsed, or Date Completed fields are reflected on the player's CSP Summary.

title: As a user I want to be able to see a "Schools" tab on the CSP/CEP Dashboard
custom_steps: Wireframe:http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_cep_schoolsData Discovery:https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=107118753Acceptance Criteria: * If a user has CSP view or edit permissions they see the "Schools" tab on the CSP/CEP Dashboard.* Clicking on the "Schools" tab will load the widget per the wireframe and the data discovery. * The browser tab text will say CSP/CEP Schools* The widget will be populated with all of the non-deleted CSP School profiles in the system. * The default sort will be on School Name. * Default column sort, filtering and exporting should work. * A submenu will be added to the main navigation with links in alphabetical order* Update the browser tab text to say CSP/CEP Players when the Players tab is active

title: As a user I want to be able to create a new CSP/CEP School Profile
custom_steps:
Wireframe:
http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=csp_cep_schools

Data Discovery:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+School

Acceptance Criteria: 
* On the Schools widget there should be a "Create New" Action Button for users with CSP edit permissions.
* Clicking this should launch a new, blank school profile. 
* Form should match the provided wireframe and data discovery. 
* There should be a "Save" and  "Cancel" button in grey. 
* Clicking "Cancel" will ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes, and if the user confirms it will discard the profile entirely and return the user to the point of entry. 
* Clicking "Save" will run a required field and formatting check according to the data discovery. If that passes, the system will save the profile, display a blue success notification, and reload the form in view mode. 
* After the profile has been saved, it should be available for selection in Invoices and Player Letters.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to delete a CSP/CEP School Profile
custom_steps: Wireframe:http://ll2j6l.axshare.com/#p=new_csp-cep_schoolData Discovery:https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+CSP+SchoolAcceptance Criteria: * When a BOC user with CSP edit permissions is viewing a school profile, they should see a "Delete" button. * Clicking this should ask the user to confirm that they wish to permanently delete the school profile. * If the user confirms, the system will delete the school's profile. * A blue successful notification will display. * Invoices that have been saved with this school's information prepopulated should not be impacted.

title: As a user I want to view the Elect Free Agency widget
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3788806/Data+Discovery+-+Elect+Free+Agency+Widget

Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_

Acceptance Criteria: 
* A Free Agency tab can be found, in alpha order, on the Transactions tab. 
* The Elect Free Agency - XX(B) widget is found at the top of the tab, with its own unique permission set. 
* If a user does not have this permission set, they do not see the tab. This will be a BOC only widget.
* There is a "Load Default Players" button. Clicking that will load the widget according to the data discovery and wireframe. 
* The widget columns will follow the layout of the wireframe and the provided data discovery. (Population of the widget and columns will come with followup stories)

title: As a user I want the Elect Free Agency widget to be populated with potential MJ Free Agents
custom_preconds:
Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Data+Discovery+-+Elect+Free+Agency+Widget

Predicted FA Report Details: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/EBIS4-TXT-5215+Population%2C+Logic+and+Sort+Considerations

Wireframe: 
http://b6mbog.axshare.com/#p=elect_free_agency_-_xx_b_

Acceptance Criteria: 
* The default player population for the widget should match that of the Predicted Free Agent Filings report.
 - All players with a current MAJ contract with an expiration date of the current league year. OR Any players with an option in their current MAJ contract that would make them a FA
* Default sort should be on player Last, secondary sort on First. 
* Player's name should be a hyperlink to their Player History. 
* Contract Start Year should be a hyperlink to the associated MJ Contract.

title: As a user I want to be able to view batch results from the Declare MN FA process screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=minor_league_free_agency_batch_utility

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Results" widget on the Declare MNFA process batch screen.
* By default the widget contains the results of the last batch that is included in the screen that was run. 
* The columns for the batch should match those of the columns available for the batch if it were run from its individual batch screen. 
* The header of the Results widget should include the batch's name and run information (See wire)
* Clicking on any of the individual rows within the Batch History widget should reload the Results widget with the correct information (including the different columns sets and the header information).

title: As a user I want to be able to run the Minor League Free Agent reports from the Declare MN FA process screen
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
http://7xflwf.axshare.com/#p=minor_league_free_agency_batch_utility

Acceptance Criteria: 
* There is a "Run Reports" button on the Yearly Minor League Free Agent process screen. 
* Clicking this button launches a dropdown for the user to select which report they wish to run. 
* The options are "Potential MN League Free Agents" and "Declared MN Free Agents". 
* Selecting either option will open the BO prompt for the report, allowing the user to select whatever prompts they want and run the report from there (should open in a new window).

title: As a Tester, I want to access the Lookup API through the ebis link interface
custom_steps: General API Rules: https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Club+Feed+Shared+RequirementsAcceptance Criteria: * Testers have a basic UI to select the API, and to supply input parameters* They should also see the returned API response in a readable JSON format (with indents)* The UI will have a basic Expand and collapse feature* The UI should allow the tester to login with an API credential

title: User can run MJ/MN roster reports from the reporting widget
custom_preconds: GIVEN that user is BOC
custom_steps:
WHEN user runs the following reports:


Major League Roster
Minor League Roster
custom_expected: THEN they appear with prompts and data as expected

title: As a user I want to stamp the Club's signature on the MJ/MN Outright's Notice of Disposition
custom_steps:
Acceptance Criteria:
* Once completing the below flow, the e-signed notice of disposition is attached to the MJ/MN Outright with the attachment label "Notice of Disposition".

From the Club Signature widget: 
- Selecting one or more checkboxes should enable the STAMP SIGNATURE button
- When no checkboxes are selected, button should be disabled
- Hitting Stamp Signature should insert the club's pre-stored signature into the PDF for all of the selected rows. 
- System should use the stored signature of the signatory for each row. In other words, if user selects rows for different signatories, system should stamp the appropriate stored signature for that row.
- The club's date signed field on the PDF should be automatically populated with the date of the stamping
- If the stamping was successfully complete, the forms fall off the Club e-signature widget and a notification is shown "x document(s) were successfully E-Signed"

title: As a user I want to submit a MJ Place on 60 Day DL's Notice of Disposition for e-signature
custom_steps:
Wireframes:
https://82lvmf.axshare.com/#p=submit_a_single_c_for_e-sig

E-Sig Flow:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/MJ+Notice+of+Disposition

E-Sig Messages:
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Transactions+E-Signature+-+Messages

Acceptance Criteria:
* There is an "E-Sign" button on MJ Place on 60 Day DL transactions that are in a submitted or higher state for Club users with permission to edit the transaction.
* Clicking "E-Sign" will open a menu for the user to select "Notice of Disposition".
* The user will be able to complete the e-signature workflow for the MJ Place on 60 Day DL's NOD as per the standard MJ NOD workflow including: 
 - Submitting the form for e-signature
 - Rule check for Authorized Signatory that has a stored signature  
 - Rule check that the form hasn't already been e-signed
 - Player Signature from both the Player Signature widget and the transaction itself
 - Club Signature Stamping
 - Transaction updates canceling e-signature
 - User cancellation of e-signature

* There is an "E-Sign" button on MN Place on 60 Day DL transactions that are in a submitted or higher state for Club users with permission to edit the transaction.
* Clicking "E-Sign" will open a menu for the user to select "Notice of Disposition".
